title: 14 - Valid Order Blocks - Institutional Order Zones

order_block.llm_summary: Order Block (OB) is the last bearish candle before bullish BOS (Bullish Order Block) or last bullish candle before bearish BOS (Bearish Order Block). Represents the zone where institutional orders were placed - Smart Money's buying or selling occurred here before price reversed. The candle that precedes the Break of Structure contains the institutional footprint. Order Blocks act as strong support (bullish OB) or resistance (bearish OB) when price returns. Key difference from retail S/R: OBs are based on institutional order flow, not arbitrary lines.
key_rules: Bullish OB = last bearish candle before bullish BOS
Bearish OB = last bullish candle before bearish BOS
Must be associated with BOS (not just any candle)

bullish_order_block.llm_summary: Bullish Order Block is the last bearish (red/down) candle before price breaks structure to the upside (bullish BOS). This down candle represents where Smart Money placed large buy orders that caused the subsequent upward break. The entire candle body and wicks form the OB zone. When price returns to this zone during pullback, it often finds strong support as unfilled institutional buy orders remain. Entry strategy: buy when price touches the Bullish OB during retracement in uptrend.
key_rules: Last bearish candle before bullish BOS

bearish_order_block.llm_summary: Bearish Order Block is the last bullish (green/up) candle before price breaks structure to the downside (bearish BOS). This up candle represents where Smart Money placed large sell orders that caused the subsequent downward break. When price retraces to this zone, it often finds strong resistance as unfilled institutional sell orders remain. Entry strategy: sell when price touches the Bearish OB during retracement in downtrend.
key_rules: Last bullish candle before bearish BOS

valid_vs_invalid_ob.llm_summary: Valid Order Block must meet specific criteria: 1) Must precede a Break of Structure (BOS), not just any move, 2) Must be the LAST opposite candle before BOS, 3) BOS must be confirmed (body close beyond swing), 4) OB should not have been violated/mitigated yet. Invalid OB: candles not associated with BOS, candles in middle of moves, already-mitigated OBs. Only valid OBs have institutional significance and trading power. Many retail traders mark random candles as OBs incorrectly.
valid_ob_criteria: ✓ BOS has body close beyond swing
invalid_ob_indicators: ✗ Not the last candle before BOS

ob_mitigation.llm_summary: Order Block Mitigation occurs when price returns to the OB zone and absorbs the institutional orders, reducing or eliminating the OB's power. Full mitigation = price completely fills/penetrates the OB zone. Partial mitigation = price touches OB but doesn't fully penetrate. After mitigation, OB loses strength and should not be used for future entries. Fresh (un-mitigated) OBs have highest probability. Track OB status: Fresh → Partially Mitigated → Fully Mitigated → Invalid.
key_rules: Mitigation = price returns and fills OB orders

ob_trading_strategy.llm_summary: Order Block Trading Strategy: 1) Identify trend direction, 2) Spot BOS in trend direction, 3) Mark the last opposite candle before BOS as OB, 4) Wait for price to retrace to OB, 5) Enter when price touches OB zone, 6) Stop loss beyond OB, 7) Target next swing/structure. Combine with FVG, inducement, premium/discount for confluence. OB entries provide precise entry zones with logical stop placement. Higher probability when OB aligns with other SMC concepts.
strategy_steps: 3. Mark last opposite candle as OB

key_insights: OB = last opposite candle before BOS (institutional order zone)
Bullish OB = last bearish candle before bullish BOS (support)
Bearish OB = last bullish candle before bearish BOS (resistance)
Must be associated with confirmed BOS to be valid
OB mitigation occurs when price returns and fills orders
Combine with FVG, inducement, premium/discount for best setups
OBs represent institutional footprint, not arbitrary S/R
